byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

abstract: Afghan security forces, possibly accompanied by NATO advisers, raid hospital south of Kabul, killing at least three patients believed to be affiliated with Taliban; Swedish Committee for Afghanistan, international aid agency that runs hospital, denounces operation.

headline.print_headline: 3 Die in Hospital Raid by Afghan Security Units
headline.main: Hospital Raid by Afghan Forces Is Said to Kill at Least 3

snippet: Initial reports differed on whether the units involved in the raid south of Kabul, possibly accompanied by NATO advisers, were from the Afghan Army or the police.
lead_paragraph: Initial reports differed on whether the units involved in the raid south of Kabul, possibly accompanied by NATO advisers, were from the Afghan Army or the police.
